automotive software development in one or more domains: infotainment system, ADAS/AD, V2X,powertrain, body control, telematics etc.', 'Adaptive to new technical areas, and a fast learner.', 'High standard of integrity.Degrees with majors related to computing technologies.Good communication skills in both writing and presenting.Teamwork spirit, collaborative and comfortable in a multi-cultural environment.Adaptive to new technical areas, and a fast learner.Comfortable in working with global teams geographically distributed.Passionate in system software and technical innovations.', 'Teamwork development experiences in operating system such as Android or ROS, etc.', 'Experienced in quickly setting up system stack, trying different solutions, prototyping various ideas.', 'As the world is moving towards increasingly connected and smart, there are strong demands for products that can provide the consumers a more immersive experience within vehicle. We believe there are whole lot new opportunities in operating system that are key enablers to this new horizon. If you share the same vision as us and you own abundant innovative ideas, this position is right for you.', 'Familiar with the current technology development in operating system design.', 'You will work with our global engineering teams to research, design, and develop next generation vehicle system software. You will be provided a performance stage to lead and architect the innovations in existing or new infotainment platform to fully exercise your potential and influence on automotive software technology. At the same time, we do not have strict limit on the areas you have to work on, as long as you come up with good ideas, and are eager to drive the results and see the industry impact.', 'High standard of integrity.', 'Strong track record in leading technical teams to deliver software projects or products, or architecting software design for engineering team to implement in products.', 'Working site', 'Requirements:', 'Experiences in Android Automotive, or Automotive Grade Linux, or Blackberry QNX is a big plus.']

['Nobody should be treated differently than anyone else, regardless of their role, job level, background, or absolutely anything else. Treat each other with respect, dignity, and courtesy. Assume good intent always. Be Available', 'Be available online (or in office if applicable) during the times that are aligned to the company and your specific team and when your team is operating. When You Need Help, Ask for It', "We trust each other to do a great job at all times, and shy far away from micromanaging everyone's tasks. With that comes responsibility to not waste time if you're stuck or having trouble. Raise your hand, reach out to a teammate, say something in #slack, or jump on a Zoom. No one will judge you for asking for help. Being a Team Player Participate in Team Ceremonies", "Whether it's coding practices, ticket creation standards, code reviews, quality bars, or any other standards followed by the team, they exist for a reason, follow them. If you don't agree or think things could be better, say something. Part of being the best means always evolving and constantly trying to get better, which means we have to keep asking ourselves if things can be better. Strive To Be Better", "Always participate in the things the rest of your team is participating in. If you think certain meetings or activities aren't productive, voice that opinion, but never opt-out of participating with your team. Follow Team Practices & Guidelines", "One of the coolest things about Xometry is that we never assume we're doing the best we can and are always open for improvement. We want everyone at Xometry to feel the same way. So, whether it's you trying to figure out ways to grow your career or accomplish your career goals, or whether it's little things to make our products or practices a little bit better, keep questioning the status quo and always try to be better every day. Working on the Technology Team We expect that every person in technology at all levels brings with them a foundation of technical skills. We focus less on specific languages and more on your knowledge and experience with technology. We will meet you where you are and then help you to grow from there. Our platform technology is a mix of Front-End, Back-End, and Data. What You'll Do & What You'll Bring Active participation on a software development team designing, coding, testing, and releasing functionality to our customers Close collaboration with other engineers and product managers to become a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional team Operational responsibility for the services that are owned by your team, potentially including taking part in an on-call rotation Experience working on a web application project that you can talk about, showing off some of your work Some understanding and experience (more depending on level) with front-end technologies HTML, CSS, DOM, JavaScript, Ajax and any of the common frameworks like React, Angular, Ember, Backbone, etc (really any javascript based framework) Some understanding and experience (more depending on level) with using using C#, Java, C, C++, Ruby, Python, Node or similar back-end technologies Familiarity with code management (GIT) and continuous integration build and deploy A Few Requirements Must be a US citizen, green card holder, or a legal permanent resident of the United States Excellent oral and written (English) communication skills Must be able to work core aligned hours to US Eastern Time / GMT-5 Must be able to commute to the Bethesda, MD office for team meetings/team building events on occasion What You'll Enjoy Work in a highly collaborative, self-organizing team with the ability to decide how your team works and what technologies you use Competitive salary + comprehensive benefits Flexible working hours with paid time off Health, Dental, Vision, Commuter, Dependent Care, Primary & Secondary Parental Leave, and 401K benefit options Continuous development opportunities such as onsite training, meetups, conferences, and online training subscriptions Stock Options - we're a growing startup so you get a piece of the pie And more! Xometry is the largest marketplace for custom manufacturing, connecting customers with optimal manufacturing solutions through proprietary AI algorithms. Xometry provides on-demand manufacturing services and industrial supply materials to a diverse customer base, ranging from startups to Fortune 100 companies. Our nationwide network of over 6,000 partner manufacturing facilities enables us to maintain consistently fast lead times while offering a broad array of capabilities, including CNC machining, 3D printing, sheet metal fabrication, injection molding, and urethane casting. Xometry's customers include BMW, Dell Technologies, General Electric, and NASA. If this job isn't for you but you have a friend who may be a perfect fit - share this job with them! Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Xometry participates in E-Verify and after a job offer is accepted, will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S."]

"Senior Software Engineer needed for a well-funded startup disrupting the Credit & Identity space off a decentralized data network. Based on the West Side of LA, this startup has significant funding, the founding team has an excellent track record of success and the are looking to grow the team aggressively as we move thru 2021. You'll have the opportunity to build out key platforms for a decentralized data exchange working in Python, Golang and React, along with diving into Cryptography, Encryption, online identity and security. This is still a pre-launch opportunity and chance to get in on the ground floor to disrupt a 100-year-old+ industry.\xa0", 'Free Gym Membership', 'Previous experience in FinTech, fraud, payments or ['', 'Flexibility.\xa0We value work-life balance because we know that happy employees create positive outcomes.', 'A company that gives back.', '• 1-3 years’ development experience with relational databases (preference given to MS SQL 2014 and above).', 'Meaningful work.\xa0Our employees often tell us that their work gives them a sense of purpose because it makes a difference in the lives of clinicians and homecare staff.A CEO who cares.\xa0CEO Scott Decker has continued the mission to create a culture that cares- one that appreciates and takes good care of its people. As a result, being an employee of HCHB feels like being a member of a big family.Flexibility.\xa0We value work-life balance because we know that happy employees create positive outcomes.A company that gives back.\xa0Every year, Homecare Homebase proudly supports numerous charitable fundraising initiatives that align with our mission of empowering exceptional care and helping others in need.\xa0\xa0', '• 5+ years’ development experience with .Net stack overall (preference given to recent experience with .Net Core 2.x and above).', 'What You Can Expect from Us', 'Founded in 1999, Homecare Homebase provides powerful, cloud-based software that streamlines virtually every aspect of a home health or hospice business. From scheduling, routing and patient notes to intake, approvals, billing and payment, care givers will spend less time on paperwork and more time delivering quality care to the patients they serve.', '\xa0', '• 3-5 years’ development experience with REST/WebAPI services (preference given to recent experience with current frameworks/cluster/routing technologies such as Istio/K8).', 'This position does not provide sponsorship. All applicants should either be US Citizens or Permanent Residents eligible to work in the US without immigration restrictions.', 'About Homecare Homebase', '• 1-3 years’ development experience with Azure technologies (preference given to various PaaS development experience, understanding AKS and development patterns in distributed systems).', '• 1+ years’ development experience with JavaScript/Typescript stack (preference given to recent experience TS v2.x and above + Angular 4 and above).', '• Write and execute on a high level of unit coverage across your responsible projects/focus areas.', 'A CEO who cares.\xa0CEO Scott Decker has continued the mission to create a culture that cares- one that appreciates and takes good care of its people. As a result, being an employee of HCHB feels like being a member of a big family.', '• Design, write, and execute high quality code to commercialize platforms using industry standard development patterns and practices.', 'What You Will Bring', 'What is the Role', '• 3-5 years’ experience and comfort level working with Senior Architecture colleagues in a fast paced Agile environment.', '• Be SME for KT of the platforms within the development organization.', 'Meaningful work.\xa0Our employees often tell us that their work gives them a sense of purpose because it makes a difference in the lives of clinicians and homecare staff.', 'Our Team Members Also Enjoy', 'Meaningful work.', 'Competitive pay, robust benefits, and professional development opportunities are a few of the many reasons that Homecare Homebase is a great place to build your career.', 'Looking to work on new innovation driven technologies?\xa0The Architecture Innovation team at Homecare Homebase, LLC (HCHB) is looking for a Senior Software Engineer candidate.\xa0We are currently designing, building, and shipping forward thinking systems and features based around machine learning, distributed based systems, and Hybrid Cloud Environments to empower exceptional care. Our platform connects thousands of devices in near time to help clinicians make informed decisions. Ingesting hundreds of thousands of visits daily, we process, analyze, and communicate bi-directionally vast amounts of data across the continuum of the patient.', '• Work and collaborate with other Senior Developers and Senior Architects to drive code transformation (peer reviews, code reviews, SAFe planning) within the teams.', '• Be the first technical user(s) of the platform(s), developing production level code against the platform(s).', '• 1-2 years development experience with various machine learning platforms taking experiments to production', 'Sound like a good fit?\xa0Please take a moment to apply for this position.', 'Flexibility.', '• Have an innate understanding of modern software development and CI/CD practices (Git/Azure DevOps/Release Mgmt.).', 'Homecare Homebase is dedicated to helping our clients overcome business and technological challenges that stand in the way of clinical outcomes and operational efficiency. We work with home health and hospice organizations to tackle problems big and small. Our services are rooted in systems thinking and reach across the entire organization — from Intake to Discharge — to achieve transformative results.', 'A CEO who cares.', 'A company that gives back.\xa0Every year, Homecare Homebase proudly supports numerous charitable fundraising initiatives that align with our mission of empowering exceptional care and helping others in need.\xa0\xa0', 'What You Will Do']

['', 'Candidates will be successful in this role if they are:', 'Forward-thinking and always looking for ways to improve the way we do things', 'Forward-thinking and always looking for ways to improve the way we do thingsFocused on automationSelf-startersPassionate about cloud technologies both on-prem and in CSPsTeam players with a positive attitudeAble to communicate effectivelyReliable', 'I listed the job description below.  If you are interested, apply!', 'Reliable', 'Cloud Automation Tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, vRA/vRO, CloudBolt)', 'Passionate about cloud technologies both on-prem and in CSPs', '\xa0', 'Team players with a positive attitude', 'Cloud services (Serverless, WAF, RDS, Security Groups, Transit Networks, EBS)', 'Able to communicate effectively', 'Container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, ECS, Fargate)', 'Configuration Management tools (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack)', 'Managing Linux and Windows Server operating systemsVirtualization Technologies (VMWare, RHEV, Hyper-V)Cloud Service Providers (AWS, GCP, Azure, Oracle)Cloud services (Serverless, WAF, RDS, Security Groups, Transit Networks, EBS)Configuration Management tools (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, SaltStack)Cloud Automation Tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, vRA/vRO, CloudBolt)Container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, ECS, Fargate)Scripting (Python, Perl, Bash, Sed, Awk)Experience building CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, Git, Maven, Artifactory, Nexus, Black Duck, RSpec)', 'Cloud Service Providers (AWS, GCP, Azure, Oracle)', 'Scripting experience is a plus! Everything is manual now and are looking to transform that. If you have experience writing code, long term, you will be doing the building of the CI/CD side of things toward the back half of the project. They are an ansible and python shop and knowing bash would be a huge plus.', 'We’re looking for senior-level technologists experienced with:', 'Scripting (Python, Perl, Bash, Sed, Awk)', 'From a day-to-day perspective, the role will include provisioning, migrating, managing, and automating all aspects of our infrastructure components both on-premise and in the cloud. As with any engineering type role, there will be an expectation that whoever is hired will be on call during any outage type scenarios to manage break-fixes.', 'Virtualization Technologies (VMWare, RHEV, Hyper-V)', 'Experience building CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, Git, Maven, Artifactory, Nexus, Black Duck, RSpec)', 'Self-starters', 'They are looking for a strong Linux Engineer with some cloud experience. They want someone who can migrate the servers to AWS very quickly. Initially it will be a lot of migrating physical severs into AWS. Then some virtual to visual Using Zerto but would take cloud endurance. Long term it will be looking to automate as much as they can, as they move to more of a DevOps culture.', 'Focused on automation', 'Managing Linux and Windows Server operating systems']

['', '5 years software development experience or similar field.Software development experience in Node.js (v10)Relational database experience (MySQL, Postgres), including experience in query and index optimization.Experience architecting, building and scaling systems.Experience with deploying and operating services with AWS.Experience with Git and software release workflow.Experience with Docker and containerized services.Track record of managing software projects and/or teams.Experience with multiple programming languages such as C++ and Python.Ability and desire to stay current on the latest developer tools and technologies.Desire to be a leader among a quickly growing software team', 'We are looking for engineers who bring experience and fresh ideas from a variety of fields, in particular large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, and artificial intelligence. With your technical expertise you will manage infrastructure priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will have the opportunity to build an infrastructure team as we rapidly grow, and we expect you to be a leader that mentors and provides guidance to internal teams. Additionally, we are looking for engineers who are versatile, enjoy staying current on leading-edge technology and tools, and possess an enthusiasm for taking on new challenges as we push our company forward.', 'Experience with Docker and containerized services.', 'Experience with multiple programming languages such as C++ and Python.', 'Relational database experience (MySQL, Postgres), including experience in query and index optimization.', 'As a Senior Software Engineer, you will have a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions concerning the core infrastructure of the company. As a senior member of the core team, you are a key contributor to the system foundation, architecture and integrity. Your role is to oversee and maintain system stability, optimize and reduce operational costs, enhance security, modernize services, and ensure system scalability.', '\ufeff', 'About the Job', 'We are an exciting diverse team based in beautiful San Diego. We truly use AI in everything we do, don’t have any direct competitors and have a vast global market opportunity (large TAM, SAM, and SOM).', 'Experience architecting, building and scaling systems.', 'Experience with Git and software release workflow.', 'Senior Software Engineer', 'What you’ll need to bring to the table', 'Software development experience in Node.js (v10)', 'Our AI powered solutions provide automation, self-managed programs with little to no human intervention and insights to make better business decisions, reduce costs, improve safety, compliance and more efficiently run its operations.', 'Experience with deploying and operating services with AWS.', 'About Us', 'Senior Software Engineer, Infrastructure', '5 years software development experience or similar field.', 'Ability and desire to stay current on the latest developer tools and technologies.', 'Tourmaline Labs is an AI mobility company that enables large enterprises to more effectively manage distributed workforce and assets.', 'Desire to be a leader among a quickly growing software team', 'Track record of managing software projects and/or teams.', 'We are a young and energetic company, moving very fast and it is a great time to join us, just before we substantially scale up the sales and marketing teams.']

Work with public cloud services including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform for use with our platform execution environment. Design, implement, and refine NoSQL database models for the application. Design and implement service-oriented back end web servers and daemons to perform business logic and data processing functions. In this role, you will be leading new software initiatives including design, architecture, and implementation. We need your help building, enhancing, and scaling both these execution environments and the orchestration layer that controls them. Ideal candidates will have extensive experience building multi-tier distributed systems on multiple platforms, including public clouds. They will also be knowledgeable about design patterns, algorithms, data structures (particularly graphs), operating systems, containers, web-based application architecture, and other computer science fundamentals. This position offers an amazing opportunity to hone and expand your existing skill set. Because our platform works with a wide variety of automation tools, you will almost certainly be learning something new. We are working on exciting and challenging problems in a rapidly emerging market, and need your help building the best DevSecOps automation platform available. ', 'Refactr is building a cutting-edge DevSecOps automation platform that executes workloads in in highly decoupled and distributed execution environments, ranging from public cloud containers to highly secured on-premise hardware. ['', 'Benefits At Collibra', 'Joining Collibra’s Software Engineering team:', ' {Be}Healthy: Healthcare for yourself and eligible dependents (inclusive of partners/domestic partners), mental health resources and care, tax advantaged accounts, income protection, discount programs and more! Additionally, we encourage employees to treat their whole self by offering a bi-monthly calendar of events and programming dedicated to our {Be}well initiatives which focus on wellbeing areas including emotional, professional & social, financial, physical, giving back and allyship & belonging. ', 'You Have', 'You will be cooperating with product leadership members and will report to senior leadership.', 'An effective and positive communicator (high culture of communicating with other people)', 'Measuring Success', ' Front-end architecture evaluations, designs, and consultations Front-end architecture strategy Front-end architecture best practices Collaborating with the team on technical solutions for the UX designs Following the backlog grooming meetings for the Product Teams to record the front-end needs that are to be brought back to the front-end architecture board for review, prioritization and assignment ', ' {Be}Kind: CollibraForGood, Unconscious Bias & Allyship training, Manager Racial Injustice training and Collibra-led fundraisers. ', 'Within your first month, you will get familiarized with front-end architecture, the development flow and tooling used in Collibra.', 'Equal Opportunity', 'A good knowledge of React, Relay, GraphQL/REST, Typescript, and preferably of Webpack, Node, TSLint/ESLint', '{Be}Together: Community and belonging with our ERGs and personal interest groups, ERG-driven events, speaker series, and celebrations, a dedicated DEI counsel, the virtual Collibra cafe, trivia, bingo games and much more! ', 'Be}well ', 'Reporting to Collibra’s VP Software Engineering, ', '{Be}Healthy: Healthcare for yourself and eligible dependents (inclusive of partners/domestic partners), mental health resources and care, tax advantaged accounts, income protection, discount programs and more! Additionally, we encourage employees to treat their whole self by offering a bi-monthly calendar of events and programming dedicated to our {Be}well initiatives which focus on wellbeing areas including emotional, professional & social, financial, physical, giving back and allyship & belonging.', '{Be}With Family: We offer multiple types of leave so that you can spend time with loved ones, including parental leave, carer’s leave and our annual family day. These are all complementary to our culture in which we value output over hours!', ' Familiar with front-end testing strategies and tools and CI/CD concepts and tools Experienced and motivated to collaborate with different people, cross countries in a changing work environment Courageous to propose and implement challenging solutions An effective and positive communicator (high culture of communicating with other people) Experienced at running a community of practices Someone who understands software development processes and is proficient in agile methodologies ', 'Front-end architecture strategy', '{Be}Kind: CollibraForGood, Unconscious Bias & Allyship training, Manager Racial Injustice training and Collibra-led fundraisers.', ' You will influence every part of the front-end ecosystem in Collibra. ['', ' Analyze science, engineering, business and other data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems. Perform advanced SQL and SAS Programming in data warehouse environment including use of different analysis techniques or business intelligence application development. Develop automated data quality scripts to ensure the data integrity and completeness of the data. Design and conduct analysis and outcome studies using healthcare claims, pharmacy, and lab data, employing appropriate research designs and statistical methods. Develop, validate, and execute algorithms, data models and reporting tools that answer applied research and business questions for internal and external clients. Define and deliver analytical solutions in support of healthcare business initiatives that drive short and long-term objectives. Applies understanding of key business drivers to accomplish own work. Uses expertise, judgment, and precedents to contribute to the resolution of moderately complex problems. Writes ETL (Extract / Transform / Load) processes, designs database systems and develops tools for real-time and offline analytic processing. Collaborates with client team to transform data and integrate algorithms and models into automated processes. Uses knowledge in Hadoop architecture, HDFS commands and experience designing & optimizing queries to build data pipelines. Uses programming skills in Python, Visual Studio or any of the major languages to build robust data pipelines and dynamic systems. ", "  You will be part of the technology function for Marcus, focusing on building a business intelligence and Analytics platform that enables the business to operate efficiently. You should be able to quickly build visualizations and semantic layers on top of AWS / Hadoop / Sybase / Oracle data to meet business needs, as well as be the thought leader to influence functional heads on new and innovate ways to visualize and report data that will help drive business value. You will help design data models to support new and existing Lines of business(s) to enable business teams make accurate, timely and reliable decisions.   You will participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement data products in production systems.   You will work closely with business partners and technology leaders to evaluate new BI tools that can further enhance the business' ability to analyze data. You should be able to commercialize data products and influence leadership on the value of these products. Qualifications  Advanced degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines. Hands-on experience with one or more mainstream programming languages (Python, Java, C, Scala, C++, etc.).   Hands-on experience with one or more relational database systems (Sybase, Snowflake, Oracle).   Experience in building data products from ideation to implementation.   At least 1 years' experience in a visualization tool such as Tableau/QlikView/Spotfire/Power BI. At least 1 years' experience dealing with data (structured or unstructured). Ability to explain data analysis to drive business ideas. Strong project management skills. Experience working in a start-up business or a new business line within a larger organization is preferred. ['', 'Resilient Cognitive Solutions has an immediate opening for a revolutionary problem solver.\xa0You have keen observation skills, can understand the technical and social environment, and create revolutionary tools to simplify decision making in mission-critical and business-critical situations.\xa0You will become a member of an elite team of passionate people who can see beyond the obvious to create and build revolutionary solutions for clients.\xa0', 'Do you want to know what it is like to be on the cutting edge of technology and make a difference too?\xa0Then consider joining our Cognitive Systems Engineering Intern Team!\xa0', 'LEADERSHIP:\xa0', 'LOCATION:\xa0RCS is in Pittsburgh, PA, near major universities (Carnegie Mellon and The University of Pittsburgh) and minutes away from a thriving city center.\xa0We have easy access to some of the best entertainment and sports venues in the country and Pittsburgh is ranked as one of the most livable and affordable cities.\xa0Once a thriving steel town, Pittsburgh is now known as an incubator of technology and medical innovation.', 'You will be helping support iterative evaluations of system prototypes and operational evaluations of fielded decision support systems.', 'PEOPLE:', 'You have excellent analytic, problem definition, and problem-solving skills, including:', 'You should be someone willing to relocate to Pittsburgh if it is safe to return to work in regards to COVID-19 by June 2021.', 'PEOPLE:\xa0Our people are passionate about changing the world!\xa0They know that their innovative solutions can save a person’s life, increase security, protect property, and better our communities.\xa0They help our clients improve their work-life by enabling them to make better, faster decisions.', 'analyzing a problem domain and to distilling core decision-making processes and challenges; often from rich, semi-articulated problem domains;', '\ufeff', 'if', 'You have some training in analyzing, designing, and evaluating Decision Support Systems, information visualizations, and graphical user interfaces is helpful.', 'SALARY RANGE:\xa0Competitive and commensurate with experience', 'JOB OVERVIEW:', 'LEADERSHIP:\xa0RCS is a veteran-owned consultancy under the senior leadership of William Elm, a CSE Fellow and pioneer in the field.\xa0Our leadership team encourages excellence through clear expectations while providing the freedom for innovation.\xa0We challenge the status quo and develop our people and trade with passion.\xa0This is why we all are leaders that can and do IMPROVE THE WORLD!', 'POSITION AVAILABLE: ', 'POSITION AVAILABLE: Summer 2021', 'POSITION: Junior Cognitive Systems Engineer Internship', 'You are someone with a combination of interests and education in technical and social disciplines such as General Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors Engineering, Psychology and related fields working towards a BA, BS, MS or PhD.', 'You will be helping support our design of innovative and useful UI designs for these complex domains, including creation of storyboards and mockups to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.', 'CULTURE:\xa0', 'You have excellent communication skills (oral, written).', 'identifying and adapting applicable technologies found in academic and industrial research;', 'You will have the opportunity to work as part of a multidisciplinary team with other cognitive systems engineers, our graphics department and our software department providing specifications of information, visualization, and functionality requirements as guidance for their system development efforts, under the supervision of senior and principal systems engineers.', 'You will be helping support our cognitive work analysis efforts by providing critical analytical basis for subsequent design.', 'LEADER:\xa0\xa0', 'WHAT YOU WILL DO:', 'SALARY RANGE:\xa0', 'You can work and achieve goals in a group.', ' ', 'RCS is an equal employment opportunity employer. Master's degree preferred.", 'Ability to identify, prioritize, and answer the most critical areas where analytics and modeling will have a material impact.', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills is required.', 'Sponsorship: This role does not offer visa sponsorship', 'Passion for building trustworthy, reliable, stable, and fast data products that serve customer needs.Software engineering experience and discipline in design, test, source code management and CI/CD practices.Experience in data modeling and developing SQL database solutions.Deep understanding of key algorithms and tools for developing high efficiency data processing systems.', 'Prior experience with modern web services architectures, cloud platforms, preferably AWS and Databricks.', 'Imagine what you could do here. Are you excited in leveraging your data analytical skills and strategic ideas to improve mission execution? Powerlytics, is a cutting edge, venture backed company with a portfolio of products and solutions underpinned by predictive analytics powered by proprietary databases of the anonymized tax returns of all households (150 million+) and for-profit businesses (30 million+) in the U.S. Powerlytics’ clients include top 5 banks, insurance companies, asset managers as well as alternative lenders, marketing firms and global consulting firms, among others. Powerlytics team is looking for a highly qualified Principal Data Scientist experienced with big data and large-scale analytics systems for our team’s substantial data analytics needs. This is an outstanding opportunity to join a focused team and work collaboratively to make a significant impact on our organization. You will be contributing to a large-scale data platform and providing end-to-end analytics solutions to transform rich data at Powerlytics scale into actionable insights. You will be developing outstanding features from the data sets, robust machine learning models and creating data products. We are looking for Data Scientists who love to build end to end analytics solutions and can produce high quality data artifacts at scale. The ideal candidate has experience implementing extendable data products on top of distributed computer frameworks.', '5+ years of deep experience within data science.', 'Proficiency with data extraction, transformation, and loading to support advanced analytics.', 'Additional Requirements:', 'Experience in data modeling and developing SQL database solutions.', 'Experience with a wide range of analytics techniques, econometrics, statistics, machine learning, optimization, simulation, etc.', 'As part of a small team, you will own significant responsibility in crafting, developing, and maintaining our large-scale ETL pipelines, storage, and processing services. The team is looking for a self-driven data scientist to help build useful features from the data, quickly deliver insights for various applications within the Financial Services sectors, including banking, insurance and wealth/asset management. In addition to the design and implementation of this infrastructure, you are responsible to determine the most effective models to improve data access, promote econometrics research, and eventually ship groundbreaking features to our customers. Communicate the complete data story for non-technical audience in an effective manner.']

['', 'Responsibilities:', 'Experience independently building out data new solutions and solving complex data issues, with a curious drive toward constant improvement.', '4+ years of experience with data warehouse technical architectures, ETL/ELT, reporting/analytic tools, and scripting.', 'You will be writing out new and updating existing Fivetran connectors between Snowflake and our production systems.', '3+ years of data modeling experience and proficiency in writing complex SQL with mySQL.', 'Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL.\xa0', 'Qualifications:', 'You are proficient at tuning database queries. ', 'You will be expected to be the lead data engineer responsible for designing and solving data related issues, including the ingestion of data from both internal and external production systems. ', 'You will be responsible for maintaining our current Snowflake data warehouse as well as helping to revamp our data structure with our ever-increasing complex and modern systems.', 'You will be responsible for maintaining our current Snowflake data warehouse as well as helping to revamp our data structure with our ever-increasing complex and modern systems.You will be working closely with other engineers and our business partners on ensuring that we’re capturing all requested data into our data warehouse.You will be advising us with redesigning the data structure as our company expands into new business opportunities.You will be expected to be the lead data engineer responsible for designing and solving data related issues, including the ingestion of data from both internal and external production systems. You will be writing out new and updating existing Fivetran connectors between Snowflake and our production systems.You will also be assisting our analytics team in managing and data migration of our BigQuery Data Warehouse.You will be responsible for reporting on project progress and will be responsible on production systems maintenance.You will also assist us with evaluating future data warehousing needs and toolset to improve our reporting needs.', 'Experience working in SQL and noSQL databases.', '5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.4+ years of experience with data warehouse technical architectures, ETL/ELT, reporting/analytic tools, and scripting.3+ years of data modeling experience and proficiency in writing complex SQL with mySQL.Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL.\xa0Experience working in SQL and noSQL databases.Experience with AWS services including S3, RDS, Data-pipeline, Lambda, etc.Experience in scripting languages such as Python.You are proficient at tuning database queries. Experience independently building out data new solutions and solving complex data issues, with a curious drive toward constant improvement.You should have great communication skills and experience coordinating with both business stakeholders and software engineers.\xa0', 'You will be working closely with other engineers and our business partners on ensuring that we’re capturing all requested data into our data warehouse.', 'Experience in scripting languages such as Python.', 'You should have great communication skills and experience coordinating with both business stakeholders and software engineers.\xa0', 'You will be responsible for reporting on project progress and will be responsible on production systems maintenance.', 'You will be advising us with redesigning the data structure as our company expands into new business opportunities.', 'You will also assist us with evaluating future data warehousing needs and toolset to improve our reporting needs.', '5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.', 'Experience with AWS services including S3, RDS, Data-pipeline, Lambda, etc.', 'You will also be assisting our analytics team in managing and data migration of our BigQuery Data Warehouse.']

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us at accommodations-ext@snap.com.', 'Some core features we build and maintain include Snapchat’s Camera, Creative Tools, Maps, Chat, Memories, Stories, Discover, Games, and Minis. Our Infrastructure teams deliver an innovative and cost-efficient platform that ensures Snapchat is the fastest way to communicate with your friends, no matter where you are in the world. We have one of the fastest growing digital ad platforms, and our Monetization teams drive measurable returns for advertisers through novel ad formats like Augmented Reality. As a Snap Engineering team member, you’ll help us build the future of communication.', 'Build best in class testing tools and infrastructure to support functional and load testing of Snapchat’s multi-cloud backend servicesArchitect new framework and services to speed up detection of bugs and regressions in the CI/CD pipeline.Work across teams to understand product requirements, evaluate trade-offs, and deliver the solutions needed to build innovative productsAdvocate for and apply best practices when it comes to availability, scalability, operational excellence, and cost managementBeing part of a passionate team that is building Snapchat’s testing tools and infrastructure', 'The drive to learn new technologies and frameworks', 'Architect new framework and services to speed up detection of bugs and regressions in the CI/CD pipeline.', '5+ years work experience as a software development engineer and/or software development engineer in testExperience with large-scale microservices or distributed systemsExperience with backend automation tools and frameworkExperience with Android/iOS automation tools and framework is a plusExperience with build infrastructure and continuous integration/deploymentAutomation framework and tools development experiences is a plusExperiences with Google/AWS services is a plusThe drive to learn new technologies and frameworksA self starter who enjoys building new tools and servicesA team player attitude who enjoys working with other passionate engineers', 'Experience with backend automation tools and framework', 'Being part of a passionate team that is building Snapchat’s testing tools and infrastructure', 'Experience with large-scale microservices or distributed systems', 'What you’ll do:', 'Snap Engineering teams build fun and technically sophisticated products that reach hundreds of millions of Snapchatters around the world, every day. We’re deeply committed to the well-being of everyone in our global community, which is why our values are at the root of everything we do. We move fast, with precision, and always execute with privacy at the forefront.', 'Santa Monica, CA', 'Advocate for and apply best practices when it comes to availability, scalability, operational excellence, and cost management']

['', 'A track record of leading projects to success over many years (5-7+ years of experience)Deep experience in building data platforms at scale for both ad hoc analytical and batch processing workloadsExperience in streaming event architecturesA passion for leading by example, mentoring engineers, and sharing your expertise with the rest of the teamA strong understanding of cloud computing with 4+ years of working with AWS', 'A passion for leading by example, mentoring engineers, and sharing your expertise with the rest of the team', 'What we’re looking for', 'Deep experience in building data platforms at scale for both ad hoc analytical and batch processing workloads', 'Heap’s mission is to power business decisions with truth. We’re building infrastructure to automatically capture customer interactions on web and mobile applications, make sense of them, and make them actionable for anyone. We want to enable everyone to understand their millionth customer as well as they understood their first.\xa0', 'People are what make Heap awesome. Regardless of age, education, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or any personal characteristics, we want everyone to feel welcome. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive equal opportunity workplace everyone can call home.', 'Experience in streaming event architectures', 'A strong understanding of cloud computing with 4+ years of working with AWS', 'US West', 'We’re looking for a seasoned backend platform engineer to take the lead on some of the most challenging projects on our Data Platform team. As a member of the Data Platform team you’ll be responsible for extending and scaling the core platform that runs all of Heap. You’ll improve bottlenecks in our event ingestion pipeline (Kafka / Scala) to help us scale to hundreds of billions of events every day, optimize and extend the distributed database engine that powers our analytical workloads (Postgres / Citus), and help build out a new data lake system for batch querying. You’ll help us break up monolithic services into smaller, more manageable chunks, and define clearer API boundaries and object schemas across Heap services.', 'Australian (EST) time zones', 'We’re a distributed team that operates mostly in US West and Australian (EST) time zones. We’re open to hiring the right person anywhere within those timezones.', 'A track record of leading projects to success over many years (5-7+ years of experience)', 'Under the hood, Heap is powered by TypeScript, Golang, Scala, Spark, Kafka, and CitusDB (PostgreSQL) and Redis. For more about our architecture, check out Virtual Events: Making Data-Driven Decisions a Reality.', "Heap has raised $95M in funding from NEA, Y Combinator, Menlo Ventures, SVAngel, Sam Altman, Garry Tan, Alexis Ohanian, Harj Taggar, Ram Shriram, and others. We offer plenty of awesome benefits, and we were named #1 on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work (SMB). We'd love to hear from you!"]

job_title: 1st Python Software Engineer in the US - Series B ($100m+) – Business Workflow Automation Platform Start-Up
job_text: ['', 'Working as the first PS python software engineer in the US you will focus on customer satisfaction and support.', 'MUST have 3-5 years experience in hands-on Python development.Currently either in a Software Engineering or Professional Services role.Experience with data wrangling/Machine Learning/Natural Language ProcessingHave strong communication skills and the ability to explain complex technologies.Have a start-up mentality - this is exciting but challenging in equal measure.Based in NYC.', 'Be the key point of contact and assist customers with python coding to ensure their customer applications are able to run/perform successfully.', 'Experience with data wrangling/Machine Learning/Natural Language Processing', 'Based in NYC.', 'Currently either in a Software Engineering or Professional Services role.', 'Working closely with the VP to shape and add process into the PS function with a roadmap into leadership.\xa0', 'This company will become a household name within the next few years and now is definitely the time to get onboard. GET IN TOUCH for more information!', "This person will be central to understanding customers' pain points and designing end-to-end solutions to address these. They will also be a pivotal member of the tech team who will hugely influence future iterations of the solution as it develops within the market.", "Orama are proud to be exclusively partnered with a Start-Up who are changing how enterprise businesses can use the latest advances in NLP/AI to automate their critical application workflows. With huge attention from leading VC's which has led to $100m+ of funding in less than 5 years and a significant number of enterprise customers, they are now looking to build their professional services team out in the USA - starting with a python software engineer.", '1st Python Software Engineer - Series B ($100m+) – Business Workflow Automation Platform Start-Up', '\xa0', '\xa0\xa0', '1st Python Software Engineer - Series B ($100m+) – Business Workflow Automation Platform Start-Up\xa0', 'In order to apply for this role you will have the following experience:', 'Solutions Architecture - coming up with a specific solution plan and design.', 'Have strong communication skills and the ability to explain complex technologies.', 'Have a start-up mentality - this is exciting but challenging in equal measure.', 'Salary $200-250k OTE + STOCK', 'Design and manage the implementation and adoption plan for the customer.', 'Working as the first PS python software engineer in the US you will focus on customer satisfaction and support.Solutions Architecture - coming up with a specific solution plan and design.Design and manage the implementation and adoption plan for the customer.Be the key point of contact and assist customers with python coding to ensure their customer applications are able to run/perform successfully.Working closely with the VP to shape and add process into the PS function with a roadmap into leadership.\xa0', 'MUST have 3-5 years experience in hands-on Python development.']

Good experience in end-to-end implementation of DW BI projects, especially in data warehouse and mart developments  Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL, Unix shell scripting  Knowledge and experience with full SDLC lifecycle  Experience with Lean / Agile development methodologies  U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Residency required; we are not able to sponsor at this time ', 'Domain', ' Python Data Developer ', 'Skillset']

['', 'Understanding of and experience with the five pillars of well-architected frameworks', 'AWS certifications are a plusKnowledge of web services, API, REST, and RPC', 'Experience in several of the following areas: database architecture, ETL, business intelligence, big data, machine learning, advanced analytics', 'AWS certifications are a plus', '\ufeff', 'About the Client:', '3+ years of experience architecting, designing, developing, and implementing cloud solutions on AWS platforms', '\xa0', 'Proven ability to collaborative with multi-disciplinary teams of business analysts, developers, data scientists, and subject matter experts', 'Preferred Qualifications:', '3+ years of experience architecting, designing, developing, and implementing cloud solutions on AWS platformsUnderstanding of and experience with the five pillars of well-architected frameworksExperience in several of the following areas: database architecture, ETL, business intelligence, big data, machine learning, advanced analyticsProven ability to collaborative with multi-disciplinary teams of business analysts, developers, data scientists, and subject matter experts', '*No third-party or H1-B candidates will be accepted.\xa0', "Our Client's cloud computing continues to allow us to modernize and consolidate IT infrastructure, automate workloads, and pursue next-generation innovation. To continue this transformation, we’re seeking an experienced Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud engineer with expertise in the strategy, design, development, and implementation of large-scale projects in the cloud. The ideal candidate is experienced in cloud-based tech, with a firm grasp of emerging technologies, platforms, and applications, and the ability to customize them to help our business become more secure and efficient. Extensive knowledge of cloud maintenance, experience managing staff, and advanced industry knowledge is key to keeping us on the cutting edge. From day one, you’ll have an immediate impact on the day-to-day efficiency of our IT operations, and an ongoing impact on our overall growth.", 'Title:\xa0Cloud Engineer (AWS)', 'Title:', "Our client is a technology and services company that provides the data foundation for the world's best companies.  They are a leader in identity and the ethical use of data for more than five decades.", 'Required Skills and Qualifications: ', 'Knowledge of web services, API, REST, and RPC', '*No third-party or H1-B candidates will be accepted.', 'Location:\xa0Remote', 'About the Client:\xa0', 'The Role:', 'Location:\xa0']

job_title: Senior Data Engineer - Riot Data Products, Aggregations
job_text: ['', '2+ Years of experience developing data pipelines and data modeling.', 'Experience with software development lifecycle.', 'You will work with the data scientists and engineers on your team to develop new capabilities in the cross game problem space.', 'Senior Data Engineer on the RDP Aggregations team', 'You will partner with researchers, analysts, and advisers to ensure the time they spend transforming data to answer their questions are minimal.', 'Desired Qualifications', ' 3+ Years of professional programming experience in SQL and Python or Java. 2+ Years of experience developing data pipelines and data modeling. Experience with cloud data tools (AWS, GCP). Experience working directly with end data users and meeting their requirements. Proficiency in data structures and algorithms. ', 'Experience with cloud data tools (AWS, GCP).', 'Responsibilities', 'Experience working directly with end data users and meeting their requirements.', 'Experience developing an enterprise data warehouse spanning across multiple teams.', "It’s our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and members of Riot Games, Inc. Riot Games makes reasonable accommodations for handicapped and disabled Rioters and does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, handicap, veteran status, marital status, criminal history, or any other category protected by applicable federal and state law, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance relating to an applicant's criminal history (LAMC 189.00).", 'Required Qualifications', ' Experience developing an enterprise data warehouse spanning across multiple teams. Experience with software development lifecycle. Experience working collaboratively in a team environment. Experience with Spark and BigQuery. ', 'Experience working collaboratively in a team environment.', 'Experience with Spark and BigQuery.', '3+ Years of professional programming experience in SQL and Python or Java.', 'You will transform raw data to datasets that end-users can easily query.', 'You will advocate for best practices and identify opportunities for the team to improve the sustainability of our portfolio.', ' You will partner with researchers, analysts, and advisers to ensure the time they spend transforming data to answer their questions are minimal. You will transform raw data to datasets that end-users can easily query. You will work with the data scientists and engineers on your team to develop new capabilities in the cross game problem space. You will advocate for best practices and identify opportunities for the team to improve the sustainability of our portfolio. ', 'Proficiency in data structures and algorithms.', 'Our Perks']

job_text: ['', '2+ years of full stack experience using Python and Django\xa0', 'Provide estimates for your work.', 'Be in the code every day helping build new features and fixing issues.\xa0', 'Do PR reviews and give constructive feedback to other engineers on the team.\xa0', '\xa0Ability to balance focusing on output and meeting business needs with maintaining code quality.\xa0', 'Passionate about software development, you do this because you love it.\xa0', 'Attend daily standups and ad hoc meetings like design reviews.\xa0', 'You should have:', 'Company Description:', 'As a Software Engineer you will:\xa0', 'As a Software Engineer you will:\xa0Be in the code every day helping build new features and fixing issues.\xa0Do PR reviews and give constructive feedback to other engineers on the team.\xa0Attend daily standups and ad hoc meetings like design reviews.\xa0Collaborate closely with other engineers, product, and design.\xa0Provide estimates for your work.', '2+ years recent experience using React, bonus points if you have experience with Typescript, Postgres, Docker, or Kubernetes.', "Our technology helps senior care providers close the feedback loop with their employees and the seniors that they serve so they can make better decisions and provide better care. Today, our survey and analytics platform supports the voices of over half a million employees, seniors, and family members at over 4,000 locations. Now during the pandemic, we’re helping senior care providers understand their employees’ and their seniors' needs as they face unprecedented challenges. We’re a close-knit remote team that cares about working hard to do good in the world, while also making sure that we can all live balanced lives. As our user base grows, we’re looking for an experienced engineer to join our team to help scale our platform and expand our product offerings. We’re using data to transform the aging experience of our parents, our grandparents, our loved ones - and ultimately, for ourselves. Come join us!", 'Thrive when working remotely.\xa0', 'You love the small team startup environment and working hard and fast to have a big personal impact.\xa0', 'Collaborate closely with other engineers, product, and design.\xa0', '2+ years of full stack experience using Python and Django\xa02+ years recent experience using React, bonus points if you have experience with Typescript, Postgres, Docker, or Kubernetes.\xa0Ability to balance focusing on output and meeting business needs with maintaining code quality.\xa0Passionate about software development, you do this because you love it.\xa0You love the small team startup environment and working hard and fast to have a big personal impact.\xa0Thrive when working remotely.\xa0']

['', "Considerable hands-on experience in space systems engineering and mission design of spacecraft and/or other equivalent applications.Bachelor's degree in Aerospace Engineering or related technical fieldExperience in Program Management including cost, schedule, and technical managementExperience in requirements and verification management\xa0", 'You will relish the opportunity to be part of an innovative company with a team of individuals who are self-starters and driven for success.', 'Evaluate and champion new technology and methods.', 'System concept and architecture development, requirements and verification method development, systems trade studies, and mission modeling', 'Design and development of state-of-the art system for LEO constellation satellites optimizing for system simplicity, mass efficiency, launch vehicle accommodation efficiency, and production cost.', 'The successful candidate will be innovative, creative, and challenge the status quo. He or she will work well in teams while also having the ability to lead a small team and to work assignments autonomously. We are looking for people with the following experience:', 'Qualifications', 'Leading teams to support design, modeling, and integration of spacecraft bus hardware and flight software', 'Experience in requirements and verification management\xa0', 'Technical support for production and test of satellite structure and the associated hardware.', 'Considerable hands-on experience in space systems engineering and mission design of spacecraft and/or other equivalent applications.', "Bachelor's degree in Aerospace Engineering or related technical field", 'We want to appoint a talented Senior Systems Engineer who will work on mission and satellite advancement, and process sustainment and growth. The effort includes rapid and iterative design, development, testing and evaluation, as well as enhancement of existing spacecraft design. We are working with the following technologies, platforms, and methodologies:\xa0', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0Behavioral Driven Development / Test Driven Development', 'Transformative innovation is happening in the electric industry; from digitalizing homes and distributed resources, to renewable energy and an ever-changing grid. MISO manages the electricity superhighway in the Central U.S. and through use of groundbreaking research and advanced technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 42 million Americans. Operating the electricity grid, running a robust energy market, planning for a bright future – it’s what our immensely talented and dedicated team does every day.\xa0', 'We’re looking for a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related technical field; or at least 6 years of relevant work experience.\xa0We’re also looking for experience in designing, developing, debugging, and operating resilient distributed systems, and have a passion for automation.', 'As our Senior Java Software Engineer, you will be part of a team developing applications that are critical to the reliability of the electric grid. Be a part of an Agile environment, drive innovations that improve system availability, resilience and performance, and be a part of resolving complex technical issues.\xa0', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0Be capable of driving and delivering thin slices of functionality on a regular cadence with data-driven feedback loops in an agile environment\xa0']

['Nobody should be treated differently than anyone else, regardless of their role, job level, background, or absolutely anything else. Treat each other with respect, dignity, and courtesy. Assume good intent always. Be Available', 'Be available online (or in office if applicable) during the times that are aligned to the company and your specific team and when your team is operating. When You Need Help, Ask for It', "We trust each other to do a great job at all times, and shy far away from micromanaging everyone's tasks. With that comes responsibility to not waste time if you're stuck or having trouble. Raise your hand, reach out to a teammate, say something in #slack, or jump on a Zoom. No one will judge you for asking for help. Being a Team Player Participate in Team Ceremonies", "Whether it's coding practices, ticket creation standards, code reviews, quality bars, or any other standards followed by the team, they exist for a reason, follow them. If you don't agree or think things could be better, say something. Part of being the best means always evolving and constantly trying to get better, which means we have to keep asking ourselves if things can be better. Strive To Be Better", "Always participate in the things the rest of your team is participating in. If you think certain meetings or activities aren't productive, voice that opinion, but never opt-out of participating with your team. Follow Team Practices & Guidelines", "One of the coolest things about Xometry is that we never assume we're doing the best we can and are always open for improvement. We want everyone at Xometry to feel the same way. So, whether it's you trying to figure out ways to grow your career or accomplish your career goals, or whether it's little things to make our products or practices a little bit better, keep questioning the status quo and always try to be better every day. Working on the Technology Team We expect that every person in technology at all levels brings with them a foundation of technical skills. We focus less on specific languages and more on your knowledge and experience with technology. We will meet you where you are and then help you to grow from there. Our platform technology is a mix of Front-End, Back-End, and Data. What You'll Do & What You'll Bring Active participation on a software development team designing, coding, testing, and releasing functionality to our customers Close collaboration with other engineers and product managers to become a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional team Operational responsibility for the services that are owned by your team, potentially including taking part in an on-call rotation Experience working on a web application project that you can talk about, showing off some of your work Some understanding and experience (more depending on level) with front-end technologies HTML, CSS, DOM, JavaScript, Ajax and any of the common frameworks like React, Angular, Ember, Backbone, etc (really any javascript based framework) Some understanding and experience (more depending on level) with using using C#, Java, C, C++, Ruby, Python, Node or similar back-end technologies Familiarity with code management (GIT) and continuous integration build and deploy A Few Requirements Must be a US citizen, green card holder, or a legal permanent resident of the United States Excellent oral and written (English) communication skills Must be able to work core aligned hours to US Eastern Time / GMT-5 Must be able to commute to the Lexington, KY office for team meetings/team building events on occasion What You'll Enjoy Work in a highly collaborative, self-organizing team with the ability to decide how your team works and what technologies you use Competitive salary + comprehensive benefits Flexible working hours with paid time off Health, Dental, Vision, Commuter, Dependent Care, Primary & Secondary Parental Leave, and 401K benefit options Continuous development opportunities such as onsite training, meetups, conferences, and online training subscriptions Stock Options - we're a growing startup so you get a piece of the pie And more! Xometry is the largest marketplace for custom manufacturing, connecting customers with optimal manufacturing solutions through proprietary AI algorithms. Xometry provides on-demand manufacturing services and industrial supply materials to a diverse customer base, ranging from startups to Fortune 100 companies. Our nationwide network of over 6,000 partner manufacturing facilities enables us to maintain consistently fast lead times while offering a broad array of capabilities, including CNC machining, 3D printing, sheet metal fabrication, injection molding, and urethane casting. Xometry's customers include BMW, Dell Technologies, General Electric, and NASA. If this job isn't for you but you have a friend who may be a perfect fit - share this job with them! Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Xometry participates in E-Verify and after a job offer is accepted, will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S."]

job_title: Backend Software Engineer (Cloud Operations) up to $250,000 plus Equity
job_text: ['', 'General Requirements:', 'Responsibilities:', 'Required Skills:', 'We are looking for a Backend Engineer to join their growing team of top notch engineers and scientists to help build and operate the cloud infrastructure for our SaaS platform. We have a modern technology stack built on Kubernetes, Spark, TensorFlow, Python, Go, Mysql & Redis. We are growing fast and are looking for someone that will be excited to join our team and help expand our global footprint.', 'Requirements: BS or MS from a top notch CS programs 5+ years professional experience in hands-on engineering roles 2+ years operating high traffic production environments in public clouds: AWS, GCP, Azure Python programming experience in production environments Experience with modern cloud environments: containerization, infrastructure-as-code, devops, CI/CD pipelines and general automation Hands on experience with network security, databases systems Preferred: Operating Kubernetes clusters Experience with cloud and infrastructure security regulations & compliance: SOC2, ISO27001, HIPAA, GDPR, CCPA Experience with ML Ops: Spark, TensorFlow, GPUs Experience with Terraform', 'Job Description:', 'We are founded by ex-Google, Amazon, Dartmouth and IIT team and funded by Eric Schmidt and Decibel Ventures with Series A funding of $ 18 million', 'Company Description:', 'Preferred: Operating Kubernetes clusters Experience with cloud and infrastructure security regulations & compliance: SOC2, ISO27001, HIPAA, GDPR, CCPA Experience with ML Ops: Spark, TensorFlow, GPUs Experience with Terraform', 'Public clouds: AWS, GCP, Azure, modern cloud environments: containerization, infrastructure-as-code, devops, CI/CD pipelines and general automation Hands on experience with network security, databases systems', 'Nice to haves:']

['', 'Must', 'All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.', 'The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.', 'We leverage our platform in combination with our over 25 years of storage industry expertise to help our thousands of storage customers achieve their tenant experience and operational efficiency objectives every single day.', 'Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using various SQL and ‘big data’ technologies', 'Storable is looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Architecture team in Austin. This team member will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our cloud native big data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing distributed systems as well as building them from the ground up.\xa0', 'Fun company events, including Halloween costume contests, ugly sweater competitions, baseball game outings, ice cream socials, food trucks, and more.', 'What you need to bring to the table:', 'The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on stakeholder initiatives and ensure delivered architecture is consistent and supportable throughout ongoing projects. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products.\xa0', 'Must\xa0be located on:\xa0TX, KS, NC, MO, CO, PA, IL, IN', 'Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics', 'Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems', 'Computer science degree or equivalent experience', 'Instant-Access & Flexible vacation. We trust you, so we have a ‘take what you need’ vacation policy. job_title: Data Analyst Intern - Vehicle Systems Architecture
job_text: ['', 'V-Model look up or Vehicle Systems Engineering is a plus!', 'Physical qualifications may require testing in a lab environment', ' Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or equivalent Fluid coding experience required, Python, C++, Java or relative V-Model look up or Vehicle Systems Engineering is a plus! FSAE experience preferred Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment  Physical qualifications may require testing in a lab environment Working Hours: Full-time, 40 hours/week required Less than 10% travel may be required ', 'Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment ', 'Fluid coding experience required, Python, C++, Java or relative', 'Perform real-time programming based on the variation calculation and error analysis.', ' Perform Design Failure Mode Analysis (DFMEA) on functions to generate design requirements andverification tests Assist with the data integrity and digital linking to establish end-to-end requirements and verifications Support the engineering teams in the development of engineering tools in to implementoptimization techniques and develop numerical search algorithms in the controls application of vehiclesystems. Develop appropriate optimal control solutions based on failure analysis over the vehicle control system usingModel Predictive Control (MPC). Apply optimal control concepts (Bellman’s principle of optimality, Pontryagin’s maximum principle, etc.) toimprove system functionality over various time domains. Perform real-time programming based on the variation calculation and error analysis. Implement and validate control algorithms for vehicle control applications ', 'Apply optimal control concepts (Bellman’s principle of optimality, Pontryagin’s maximum principle, etc.) toimprove system functionality over various time domains.', 'Less than 10% travel may be required', 'Working Hours: Full-time, 40 hours/week required', 'Role Summary', 'Implement and validate control algorithms for vehicle control applications', 'FSAE experience preferred', 'Responsibilities', 'Perform Design Failure Mode Analysis (DFMEA) on functions to generate design requirements andverification tests', 'Qualifications', 'Develop appropriate optimal control solutions based on failure analysis over the vehicle control system usingModel Predictive Control (MPC).', 'Assist with the data integrity and digital linking to establish end-to-end requirements and verifications', 'Support the engineering teams in the development of engineering tools in to implementoptimization techniques and develop numerical search algorithms in the controls application of vehiclesystems.', 'Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, or equivalent']

['', ' Build and evolve the tools that empower colleagues and teams across our organization to access data and build reliable and scalable transformations.', ' We develop real products. You need to be an expert in design, coding and scripting We prioritize professional industry experience; advanced degrees alone do not replace real world experience We have massive scale. You need to have experience in distributed, scalable systems. You must have worked with modern data storage, messaging, and processing tools and demonstrated experience designing and coding in big-data components. We are a growing, diverse team and we work together on delivering a Health Cloud platform. We love to collaborate and help each other, and we want someone to share that ideology We are and need other self-starters who can see the big picture and prioritize their work to make the largest impact on the business and customers vision and requirements', ' Design and build out our digital data platform in a cloud scalable environment Able to design, build, operationalize, secure, and monitor data processing systems with a particular emphasis on security and compliance, scalability and efficiency, reliability, flexibility and portability. Architect, design, implement and support data integration patterns for enterprise-scale datasets, using Big Data technologies such as Kafka, data streaming, Spark, relational and NoSQL data stores. Establish frameworks for application integration with big data and IoT datasets, including connected devices and electronic medical records. Build and evolve the tools that empower colleagues and teams across our organization to access data and build reliable and scalable transformations. Build systems that secure and govern our data end to end: control access across multiple storage and access layers (including BI tools), track data quality, catalog datasets and their lineage, audit usage and ensure correct data semantics. Demonstrate a deep expertise of and ability to operationalize leading data technologies and best practices Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms. Collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, business users, project managers and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions. job_title: Data Analyst, Product Management and Governance
job_text: ['', 'Experience in product/technical program management.', 'Experience with implementing data workflows for SAP, Oracle, Salesforce or other financial or business systems.', 'Knowledge of one or more data visualization tool or platform (Data Studio, Tableau, Looker, etc.).', 'Experience in Finance, Supplier Relationship Management (SRM), Business Intelligence (BI), Master Data Management (MDM), or Big Data Analytics.', ' Manage Product and Systems design (ideation to launch, including hypercare and steady state operations) of high impact data platform and analytics solutions. ['', 'AWS/Azure/GCP', 'Application Implementation: show the customer how to write robust and scalable data access code that correctly utilizes drivers.', 'Production Operations: help the customer deploy, configure, secure, maintain, monitor, scale, troubleshoot, test and tune Enterprise clusters.', 'Instructive Consulting: in response to customer questions, provide ad-hoc instruction that is shaped by the customer’s specific environment, requirements and constraints.', 'About The Role', 'Identifying Needs: bring in the sales team when the customer will benefit from a services or license purchase / expansion.', 'Essential Job Functions', 'Data architecture, data modeling, warehousing concepts. Deep understanding of data architectures which support reporting and analytics use cases.', 'Performance techniques for accelerating Reporting / Dashboarding use cases (OLAP, Materialized Views, etc)', ' Application Architecture: tailor reference architectures to provide performance, resilient, scalable, secure, distributed architectures which can exceed SLAs and are easily maintained. Data Modeling: design and test data models which are pragmatic, performant, and scalable. Application Implementation: show the customer how to write robust and scalable data access code that correctly utilizes drivers. Infrastructure: help the customer select on-premise hardware or cloud instance types based on workload and capacity assessments. Production Operations: help the customer deploy, configure, secure, maintain, monitor, scale, troubleshoot, test and tune Enterprise clusters. Instructive Consulting: in response to customer questions, provide ad-hoc instruction that is shaped by the customer’s specific environment, requirements and constraints.
